channel.title: CyberNetSec - Data Breach
channel.description: Latest data breach threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Cl0p Implicated in Oracle Zero-Day Attacks, Breaching UPenn and University of Phoenix
item.description:
The University of Pennsylvania and the University of Phoenix have both reported data breaches resulting from the exploitation of zero-day vulnerabilities in their Oracle E-Business Suite servers. The attacks have compromised the personal information of at least 1,488 individuals at UPenn and a much ...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Actor, Vulnerability

item.title: Supply Chain Breach at Vendor Marquis Exposes Data From Dozens of US Banks
item.description:
A ransomware attack on Marquis Software Solutions, a marketing and data analytics vendor for the financial industry, has resulted in a significant supply chain data breach affecting dozens of U.S. banks and credit unions. Marquis began notifying its clients on November 26, 2025, about the incident, ...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Data Breach, Ransomware

item.title: Washington Post Breached by Clop Ransomware via Oracle Flaws
item.description:
The Washington Post has officially confirmed it was a victim of a large-scale cyberattack orchestrated by the Clop ransomware group. The threat actors exploited vulnerabilities in Oracle's E-Business Suite, compromising over 100 organizations globally. The campaign involves data exfiltration followe...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

item.title: Freedom Mobile Data Breach Exposes Customer PII via Compromised Subcontractor
item.description:
Canadian telecommunications provider Freedom Mobile announced on December 3, 2025, that it suffered a data breach after an unauthorized party gained access to its systems on October 23, 2025. The attacker leveraged the compromised account of a third-party subcontractor to access a customer account m...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack, Phishing

item.title: Under Armour Sued Over Data Breach Attributed to 'Everest' Cybercrime Group
item.description:
Athletic apparel giant Under Armour is the target of a new class action lawsuit following a November 2025 data breach. The suit, reported on December 4, 2025, claims the company was negligent in protecting the personal information of consumers and employees. The breach was allegedly carried out by t...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Actor, Policy and Compliance

item.title: Coupang Breach Exposes 33.7 Million Users in South Korea
item.description:
South Korean e-commerce leader Coupang has admitted to a significant data breach exposing the personal information of 33.7 million customers, impacting over half of South Korea's population. The breach, which began in June 2025 and was detected in mid-November, stemmed from authentication vulnerabil...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Cloud Security

item.title: FTC Slams EdTech Firm Illuminate Education Over Breach of 10M Students' Data
item.description:
The U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has taken enforcement action against education technology provider Illuminate Education for a 2021 data breach that exposed the personal and health information of 10.1 million students. The FTC alleged the company failed to implement reasonable security measur...

Severity: High

Categories: Regulatory, Data Breach, Policy and Compliance

item.title: Mystery Breach: Major Tech Firm Exposes Millions of Users' Data
item.description:
A major, but currently unnamed, technology company has reportedly suffered a massive data breach, exposing the personal data of millions of users worldwide. The breach was detected on November 24, 2025, after unusual activity was observed on the company's servers, stemming from an unspecified vulner...

Severity: Critical

item.title: Yearn Finance Hit by $9M 'Infinite Mint' Exploit
item.description:
On November 30, 2025, the DeFi protocol Yearn Finance was exploited for approximately $9 million. The attacker leveraged a flaw in a legacy yETH stableswap smart contract, using a deposit of just 16 wei (a fraction of a cent) to mint a massive 235 septillion yETH tokens. The vulnerability stemmed fr...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Data Breach, Threat Intelligence

item.title: Amazon Data Center Blueprints Leaked in Breach of Steel Contractor
item.description:
A significant data breach at Cooper Steel Fabricators, a major U.S. structural steel contractor, was reported on November 30, 2025. A threat actor is selling a 330 GB database, claiming it is a 'complete mirror' of the company's FTP server. The asking price is $28,500. The leaked data allegedly cont...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack, Industrial Control Systems
